biog.entry.name: STONE, the Hon. Dr Sharman Nancy
biog.entry.description: Biography for STONE, the Hon. Dr Sharman Nancy
biog.entry.electorate.name: Murray
biog.entry.title: Biography for STONE, the Hon. Dr Sharman Nancy
biog.entry.electorate.state.name: Member for Murray (Vic)
biog.entry.party.name: Liberal Party of Australia

parliamentary.service.title: Parliamentary Service
parliamentary.service.para: Elected to the House of Representatives for Murray, Victoria, 1996, 1998, 2001, 2004, 2007, 2010 and 2013.

ministerial.appointments.title: Ministerial Appointments
ministerial.appointments.para: Parliamentary Secretary to the Minister for the Environment and Heritage from 21.10.98 to 26.10.04.
Parliamentary Secretary to the Minister for Finance and Administration from 26.10.04 to 27.1.06.
Minister for Workforce Participation from 27.1.06 to 3.12.07.

committee.service.title: Committee Service
committee.service.para: House of Representatives Standing: Primary Industries, Resources and Rural and Regional Affairs from 29.5.96 to 31.8.98; Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Affairs from 4.6.97 to 31.8.98 and from 11.3.08 to 10.11.08; Indigenous Affairs from 4.12.13 (Chair from 11.2.14); Infrastructure, Transport, Regional Development and Local Government from 17.3.08 to 10.11.08; Education and Training from 3.2.10 to 19.7.10; Regional Australia from 16.11.10 to 25.8.11; Social Policy and Legal Affairs from 4.12.13.
Joint Statutory: Public Accounts from 29.5.96 to 1.1.98; Public Accounts and Audit from 1.1.98 to 31.8.98 and from 4.12.13 to 25.2.14.
Joint Standing: Migration from 10.11.08 to 3.2.10; Foreign Affairs, Defence and Trade from 4.12.13; Treaties from 25.2.14.

parliamentary.party.positions.title: Parliamentary Party Positions
parliamentary.party.positions.para: Member, Opposition Shadow Ministry from 6.12.07 to 14.9.10. Shadow Minister for the Environment, Heritage, the Arts and Indigenous Affairs from 6.12.07 to 22.9.08; Shadow Minister for Immigration and Citizenship from 22.9.08 to 8.12.09; Shadow Minister for Early Childhood Education and Childcare from 8.12.09 to 14.9.10; Shadow Minister for the Status of Women from 8.12.09 to 14.9.10.

party.positions.title: Party Positions
party.positions.para: President, Burwood Liberal Party Women's Section and member of various policy committees.

other.positions.title: Other Positions
other.positions.para: Government Representative on the Council for Aboriginal Reconciliation 1997-2000.

quals.work.pre.parliament.title: Qualifications and Occupation before entering Federal Parliament
quals.work.pre.parliament.para: BA(Hons), PhD (Monash), MA (La Trobe), GradDipTertEd (Hawthorn CAE).
Member, Governing Council, La Trobe University of Northern Victoria 1987-93; Governing Council, La Trobe University 1991-93.
Manager, International Development, University of Melbourne 1994-95.

electorate.title: Electorate
electorate.para: Location: Northern Victoria; it includes the centres of Avenel, Boort, Bridgewater, Cobram, Echuca, Euroa, Kyabram, Mooroopna, Murchison, Nagambie, Nathalia, Numurkah, Rochester, Rushworth, Shepparton, Tatura, Violet Town, Wedderburn and Yarrawonga.
Industries: sheep, wheat, dairy, viticulture and fruit processing industries.
State electorates: Murray includes the Victorian Legislative Assembly electorate of Shepparton, and parts of Bendigo East, Euroa, Murray Valley, Ovens Valley and Swan Hill.
